result.execSummary:
Amie L Conley was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Amie L Conley was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Conley, Amie L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amie L Conley not in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Deft has been extradited, State moves to dismiss

BTC: dismissed

Defendant Amie L Conley in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Amie L Conley in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court asks for 15CF1238 to be brought into the courtroom for bond to be addressed pursuant an off the record conversation. Bond will be modified so defendant is not in jeopardy for waiving extradition for return to the State of Illinois.
  State of Illinois req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.

BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition. Bond in 15CF1238 is modified to allow defendant to be turned over to her mother if she is released from Lake County, Illinois and for defendant to advise the Court within 48 hours of a change of address if that applies. The bond modification goes into effect only if defendant is released from Lake County. The bond reverts back to the order of Judge Jude within 48 hours of defendant being released from Lake County.
